Im sorry If I led you astray with that exclamation point, I am not at all excited- though I did try it never-the-less

I wouldn\'t recommend it

The only thing I like about it is the mission structure, which was the thing I wanted most with FSX, instead of just half-assed single missions. But it came at the cost of...everything else that made flightsim cool.

I mean I understand their attempt to target a larger audience with the more game like structure and simplistic flight model and controls, hud and the like. But they could have, at the very least thrown hardcore simmers a bone by including a complex flight model.

Moach went on a rant about this about 2-3 months ago (he and HarvesteR made a mod for MSFS 2004), relating it to the original spore demo vs the final product. While I think this will be a good game, I don\'t agree with the free to play model (check out Rise Of Flight prices for planes to know what I mean) and the gameplay is too simple for me.
I honestly don\'t even care that it\'s out. It\'s an idiotic, watered-down version of FSX, with only hawaii and a handful of planes to fly. It\'s not a simulator at all. It\'s trash.

Oh, here\'s something I bet you don\'t know: It automatically recognizes a 360 controller and comes pre-configured for it. Not a hardcore sim anymore, no sir.

I don\'t like the business model, admittedly. You get two planes and then it\'s ten bucks or more for each additional one, as far as I can tell. That\'s a tad steep. But the game itself seems pretty solid.
I tested it yesterday and it\'s pretty fine. Easy to fly but still fun. But man, so few airplanes. 2. And it are airplanes of 75 years ago.

Well, I\'ve not played MSFS since 2002... I hadn\'t realized it had advanced to that point (if you can call than an advancement).

Microsoft flight seems to have seen Rise of Flight and copyed it (rise of flight has 2 aircraft free, and costs between 7-8 dollars US for each additional one). While this is good for the people who like flying a few planes around (for the non-sim people its very low), once again, complex flight modeling is sort of needed for me to even look at it. Once again, paying for 5 planes and scenery and it would be 100 dollars at least, and with no modeling support, it basicly means I can fly what I want like FSX.

Basicly, its not my sort of game.

Yeah, the price of add-ons is a tad high (as in, by a factor of ten). That\'s one of the things I don\'t like about it. Another being the fact that it hogs both my monitors, but only displays a black screen on the secondary. 'Oh no, you\'re not watching youtube videos while you\'re playing me!' What a selfish dick of a game.

I\'ve tried this - 90%arcade, 10% one new cool aircraft.

I think a lot of the flak that MS is getting over this game comes from MS FS fans misunderstanding what it is. It\'s not MS Flight Simulator anymore, it\'s not MS FS 11. It\'s MS Flight. It\'s a completely different thing, and I believe it deserves to at least be treated and judged as a game in its own right, not just in comparison to MS FS. Comparing FS and Flight is like comparing Orbiter and KSP. They deal with the same subject matter, but approach it differently.
